Sec. 3. An arrest on a criminal charge may be
made in any place or at any time, on Sunday as
well as any other day, and in the night as well as
in the day time. But it must be borne in mind I
that, in all cases in which it is stated in these
structions that a police officer may arrest without
a warrant, it is necessary that he should witi
the commission of the offence, except the contrary
be stated in these instructions.
Sec. 4. The party arrested should be notified
of the officer's authority; and this will often pre-
vent resistance, by taking away the prospect of i
justifying or extenuating it.
